definition: to meet on the battlefield (idiom)
soldiers/a force/an army/weapons/arms/military/warlike/CL:個|个[ge4]
generic term for weapons (old)/army (matters)/military affairs
surname Rong
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: And Hezbollah and Israel have fought against each other in the past.
sentences.chinese: 而在过去真主党和以色列曾经兵戎相见。

sentences.english: Trade between nations is much better than war .
sentences.chinese: 国与国之间进行贸易往来比兵戎相见好得多。

sentences.english: They would have no inclination to meet on the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 他们不会再希望在战场上兵戎相见了。
